I/we had a very enjoyable one-week stay from the beginning - when Terry kindly picked us up from the station, and showed us the city from the best lookout - to the end, when he dropped us back to our transport. 
There is a separate sliding glass-door entrance to the room with a view onto the flower-garden from the bed, which would help any exhausted traveler to recover. There were some quite cold nights that week and yet we did n't need to use the heater. The neighborhood is not all that central for those wanting to be tourists in Canberra, but it sure is blissfully quiet. I wondered if, maybe, it 's a "mistake" to visit Canberra without a car but, since Terry very generously offered us lifts on his way to the city & back, the days were so much more comfortable.  Nevertheless, the buses are doable. Besides, this year, once in the city, a free anniversary bus connects you to every major Canberra attraction every half-hour.
Terry struck me as a very giving person who quickly establishes an easy-going rapport.  I had the feeling I was a private guest.
6099657:
Terry and Margie are an amazing and a wonderful couple. They have been a great support to us always and have become our very good friends. 1390802:
Thank you so much to Terry and Margie, who hosted us for three nights in their Garden En Suite Room in May 2013.

A lot of thought and care has gone into designing this space - to name just a few things: lots of storage space to unpack + good clothes hangers, very comfortable bed with lovely bed linen + extra blankets, lots of tourist info, great shower, fresh flowers, a decent sized table, excellent heater, good off the road parking etc.   Unexpectedly finding a bottle of bubbly in the fridge with a card wishing my husband a happy birthday was another lovely welcoming touch :)

Our dog also enjoyed her stay. She's already told us she'd like us to come back in warmer weather so we can set up her dog bed outside the room where she can enjoy the view of the garden!  She also enjoyed her off leash time at The Scar nearby, with it's weaving posts, jumps and tunnel + huge well fenced area to run around.

54993437:
+ Cozy place, heater provided kept the room warm during the night, spacious bathroom, comfortable bed, quiet, well lit, enough electric sockets
- Room could have used a vacuuming, kettle was so filthy I just bought a new one for me (13$ at Woolworths), microwave smelled burned as soon as I opened it (don't know, never experienced this before, maybe worth to check it?), fridge was replaced mid my stay for a much smaller and dirty one. Wifi slow at times or didn't connect.

I stayed for 16 nights. Nice, cozy place that had what I needed. Hosts (in my case house sitters) were easy to get a hold of. Very friendly dogs, but they are guard dogs, so they did bark when I arrived late at night. There was very little toilet paper when I arrived and I got three rolls upon request and was told if I need any more, I should buy it myself. I'm not familiar with guidelines for Airbnb hosts, or if there are any. I understand I haven't booked a hotel room and trying to see it from the host's point of view as well and not demanding much, but I've counted on that the basic amenities mentioned in a listing are for the entire stay, and really the least a host can do for a traveler is to provide the basics. I was allowed to wash my laundry two times. Had fresh towels approx every 5 days, like I wished to have. I found it a bit weird, though, that the fridge, that was in the room when I arrived, was actually for sale and was sold during my stay, so it was replaced with the original, much smaller fridge. Of course none of my business, why this was done this way,  but I wish I had been told the fridge might be replaced mid stay - I had wiped it clean and filled with food to last for my stay and all of a sudden it's replaced with a much smaller one, I could barely fit all my groceries in it, and it was dusty inside and out. Sorry to the next guest, but I only had a few days left to stay and had already wiped one fridge clean, so I just didn't bother cleaning this one.
Not meant as negative feedback, but just as info, I did see quite a few SPIDERS in the unit and was occasionally bothered by beetles and moths. I do realize I'm in Australia and there are insects everywhere; like I said, not meant as negative feedback, just giving a heads up to whoever might find the info necessary.
I wished there was a photo of the BATHROOM in the listing; sometimes I don't book a place solely because there is no pictures of the bathroom, but this time I took the risk and I was not disappointed. Spacious and functional, clean bathroom. Big sink, big mirror, spacious shower.
WIFI was slow or did not connect at times, but good most of the time.
Hosts work often in the garden during the day, so not completely private.
LOCATION wasn't very suitable for ME. I tried not to let this affect the overall score, because I do realize I should have done better research, my own bad for not doing it. This is maybe more of a feedback on the Airbnb search system (not the host) and a note for people in the same situation as me (evening person, traveling on a budget and no driver's license)  looking to book this place; I searched for a place in Canberra and Terry's place came up in the search, so I just assumed it was in Canberra, but only in the booking confirmation I noticed it's actually in NSW, so eg. the MyWay public transport card doesn't cover this area. The main reason I booked this place was because the listing said there are frequent buses to Canberra and bus stop 100m away. However, (frequent is a relative concept) I used (Hidden by Airbnb) and only found three connections a day on weekdays from the bus stop 100m away. There was another bus stop 850m away with buses approx once an hour on weekdays, last bus leaving 7pm to Canberra, last bus back from Canberra 6pm, after that it's an approx 35min walk to/from Queanbeyan bus station. At night no public transport in either direction.
IGA supermarket about 20min walk away, other supermarkets ca 35min walk away, lots of nice cafes and restaurants 20 to 30min walk away.
Quiet, very nice neighbourhood.

24811452: Omars place is quite unique and my partner and I enjoyed staying there.  In a time where many airbnb rentals are dedicated solely to renting; Omars place is lived in, with loads of books to read and artwork on the walls.   It holds all the furniture and household items you'd expect to find in someones flat.  This gave it a homely feel that (depending on who you are) allowed us to feel comfortable and relaxed.   If you don't have a car this place would hands down be the best place for you to rent as it is so close (5 mins walk) to Coles, Woolies, foodcourt, Kmart, dominoes you name it.  We stayed during the long weekend so prices were a little more expensive at a tipple over $100 per night in total, so whilst cheaper than a hotel the place was a little older and although the cleanliness of the flat didn't worry us I could imagine my mother and a few of my neurotic friends spending a couple of hours doing a thorough clean before feeling comfortable.  The block of flats  it was situated in were a little bit reminiscent of housing commission flats and I did feel the need to remove my valuables from the car just to be safe although there probably wasn't a need to do so.  The weather that weekend was absolutely boiling in the mid 30's and so although the place heats up Omar had lots fans around the place to utilise, unfortunately no reverse cycle air con.  For the regular price that Omars place is usually advertised at none of these really minor points would even rate a mention and his place is fantastic; obviously as prices climb one may notice these in passing.  Helen Omar's mother communicated with us and she was fantastic! So easy going and friendly.  She was super helpful, gave heaps of great information about check in and out and always answered speedily.  The bed was really comfortable. Although the parking space which sits between two metal poles is a little squeezy you have heaps of time and room to manoeuvre in and I think most people wouldn't have much of an issue.  I have a really wide late model Alfa Romeo, took it slowly and didn't have any problems.  The towels are absolutely top notch, thick white, new and clean.  The TV is a small monitor up on the corner of the bookshelf - which gave us a great reason to read books and go walking.  In summary I really liked the place and completely enjoyed my stay with thanks.

Unfortunately the biggest let down was not having air conditioning in the apartment. There was a few little portable fans but it gets very hot in the apartment and the fans just weren't doing it justice so it made it quite difficult to sleep.
In regards to cleaniness, all shelveing and window seals in the unit were quite dusty and we had to vacuum the floor when we arrived as we felt like the unit hadn't been vacuumed or swept. We were also finding a lot of black hairs around the place - in the drawers in the bathroom, on the floor in the bathroom, on one of the blankets. 
We had to place all of our belongings on the floor in the bedroom as the cupboards in the bedroom and drawers in the bathroom were full of their own belongings. 
The best thing about this apartment was the location. Just a quick walk to the local Woolworths & Kmart and a little further along is the local shopping strip with restaurants/shops/pubs etc.
